name: lead gen scraper w linked in

parameters.text: =Analyze the following HTML and extract all contact details: {{ $json.data }}

options.systemMessage:
=## System Prompt
You are an expert-level Data Extraction Bot. Your sole purpose is to meticulously analyze raw HTML content from a company's webpage and extract every possible piece of contact information. You must be thorough, accurate, and systematic in your approach.

## Your Task

You will be given raw HTML as input. Your task is to parse this HTML and identify all contact details. You must then structure this information into a single, clean Markdown table.

## Information to Extract

You must find the following types of information:

Contact-Related Page Links:

Scour all <a> tags.

Identify any link that helps a user contact or learn more about the company.

Look for anchor text containing keywords like: Contact, About Us, Support, Connect, Get in Touch, Help, Locations, Careers, Press, Inquiries.

Extract the full, absolute URL from the href attribute. If the link is relative (e.g., /contact), construct the full URL based on the main website's domain.

Capture the link's anchor text (the visible text of the link).

Email Addresses:

Search for all mailto: links within href attributes.

Scan the entire text content of the HTML for email address patterns (e.g., name@domain.com). Be thorough, as they are often not in <a> tags.

Phone Numbers:

Search for all tel: links within href attributes.

Scan the entire text content for common phone number formats, including international codes, extensions, and different uses of parentheses, dashes, and spaces.

Physical Addresses:

Look for structured address formats, often found in the page <footer> or within elements with classes like address or location.

Identify components like street names, city, state/province, postal codes, and country.

Pay attention to schema.org/PostalAddress microdata if present.

Other Contact Methods:

Social Media: Extract links to primary social media platforms like LinkedIn, X (Twitter), Facebook, Instagram, etc.

Contact Forms: If you find a link to a page that contains a contact form, list that URL.

## Output Format

You MUST format your entire output as a 

  {
    "Contact Method": "Contact Page Link",
    "Detail": "https://www.tmpb2b.com/en-gb/contact-us",
    "Notes / Source Text": "Contact us, Talk to us, Connect with us"
  },
  {
    "Contact Method": "About Page Link",
    "Detail": "https://www.tmpb2b.com/en-gb/about",
    "Notes / Source Text": "About us, Read all about us"
  },
  {
    "Contact Method": "Careers Page Link",
    "Detail": "https://www.tmpb2b.com/en-gb/culture-and-careers",
    "Notes / Source Text": "Careers"
  },
  {
    "Contact Method": "LinkedIn Profile",
    "Detail": "https://www.linkedin.com/company/the-marketing-practice/posts/?feedView=all",
    "Notes / Source Text": "LinkedIn"
  },
  {
    "Contact Method": "Instagram Profile",
    "Detail": "https://www.instagram.com/themarketingpractice/?hl=en",
    "Notes / Source Text": "Instagram"
  }

so it flows well in n8n 


If you dont get any available emails on the home page  then write no emails found on email page but only after a thorough check to never miss onee !

assignments.name: search_query
assignments.value: Marketing and Advertising agencies in Canada

parameters.text: =Analyze the following HTML and extract all contact details:  {{ $json.data }}

options.systemMessage:
## System Prompt
You are a specialist data extractor. Your only goal is to find email addresses and phone numbers within the provided HTML of a company's contact page.

## Your Task
1.  Meticulously scan the entire HTML for any email addresses (mailto: links or plain text) and any phone numbers (tel: links or plain text in various formats).
2.  If you cannot find any direct emails or phone numbers, check for the presence of a contact form (look for <form> tags associated with text like "contact us," "send a message," or "get in touch").
3.  You MUST output your findings as a single, clean JSON object. Do not provide any text, explanation, or markdown fences before or after the JSON.

## Output Format
Your entire output must be ONLY the JSON object, structured exactly like this:
{
  "emails": ["email@example.com", "another@example.com"],
  "phones": ["+1-555-123-4567", "(555) 987-6543"],
  "contact_form_present": true,
  "summary": "Found two emails and a contact form on the page."
}

## Rules
- If no emails are found, the "emails" array should be empty: [].
- If no phone numbers are found, the "phones" array should be empty: [].
- If no contact form is detected, "contact_form_present" should be false.
- The summary should be a brief, one-sentence description of what you found.

parameters.content:
### Section 1: Initialization & Search ðŸš€
This section's job is to take your input and get a list of potential websites from Google.

Manual Trigger: The "Go" button for the entire workflow.

Edit Fields (Set): This is your control panel.

Purpose: To define the Google search query for this run.

Key Config: The search_query variable is set here (e.g., "web designing agency ahmedabad").

Serper Search: The Google searcher.

Purpose: Executes a Google search using the query from the "Edit Fields" node.

Key Config: The q parameter in the JSON body is set to {{ $json.search_query }}

### Section 2: Lead Parsing & Smart Filtering ðŸ§¹
This section cleans up the raw Google results and removes junk.

parse search results: The first cleanup step.

Purpose: Converts the raw, complex JSON from Serper into a simple list of leads containing company_name, website, and snippet.

Normalize leads: The smart filter.

Purpose: Cleans up the company names and website URLs. Most importantly, it filters out directories (clutch.co, designrush.com) and junk results (youtube, reddit, job listings) by searching for keywords in the search result titles.

Output: A clean list of high-quality leads to be processed.

### Section 3: Main Loop & Homepage Scraping ðŸ”„
This section processes each lead from the clean list, one by one.

Loop Over Items: The engine of the workflow.

Purpose: Takes the list of leads and processes them sequentially.

Key Config: Batch Size is set to 1 to ensure it processes one company completely before starting the next.

Wait: The politeness node.

Purpose: Pauses for 1.5 seconds between requests to avoid overwhelming a company's server.

Fetch Homepage: The first scraper.

Purpose: Scrapes the full HTML content of the lead's main website.

Key Config: The url parameter is set to ={{ $json.website }} from the looped item.

### Section 4: Homepage Analysis (First Pass AI) ðŸ¤–
This section does a quick scan of the homepage to find potential clues.

AI Agent: The generalist investigator.

Purpose: Analyzes the raw HTML of the homepage.

Key Config: Its system prompt asks it to find all potential contact links, social media profiles, and any other contact info, and to format it as a table.

Format output: The data splitter.

Purpose: Takes the single text output from the AI and splits it into multiple separate items (one for each link, one for each email found, etc.).

### Section 5: Deep Scan Branch ðŸ•µï¸â€â™‚ï¸
This is the advanced part. It takes the clues from the homepage and investigates them further.

IF Node: The gatekeeper.

Purpose: Filters the items from the homepage scan, only allowing useful links (containing "Contact", "About", "Career", etc.) to pass through for a deeper scan.

Fetch Contact Page: The second scraper.

Purpose: Scrapes the HTML of the specific internal pages (e.g., the About Us page) that the IF node allowed through.

Key Config: The url parameter is set to ={{ $json.Detail }}.

AI Agent1 (AI Deep Scan): The specialist investigator.

Purpose: Analyzes the HTML from the internal pages with the single goal of finding emails and phone numbers.

Key Config: Its system prompt asks it to return only a clean JSON object, making the data easy to use.

### Section 6: Data Aggregation & Saving ðŸ’¾
This is the final assembly line where all the data is collected and saved.

Aggregate Results: The collector.

Purpose: Gathers all the findings from the multiple pages scanned in the deep scan branch and combines them into one clean object, removing any duplicate emails or phone numbers.

Merge: The final assembler.

Purpose: Combines the original lead info (company name, website) with the aggregated findings from the deep scan.

parameters.text: =Analyze this page and give me the Details of this linked profile or company :  {{ $json.data }}

options.systemMessage:
## System Prompt
You are an expert at analyzing the data from a LinkedIn company page. Your goal is to extract key business information.

## Your Task
Analyze the provided data and extract the following details. If a detail is not present, use an empty string "" or null.

## Output Format
You MUST output a single, clean JSON object. Do not use markdown.
{
  "linkedin_summary":,
  "employee_count": ,
  "industry": ,
  "headquarters": 
  "email":.
"contact  details":,
"adresss":,
}
